content.text:
[@spencer](@pMMUGwiEuuU1WKTQlby9SM/wkY4s0VKLqZ+P+Wmewpc=.ed25519) 

I think "scuttling" means it's indexing the database. If it lasts for more than a few minutes, I'd recommend restarting Patchwork. Any chance Patchwork may be running in the background or something? Sometimes I'll get a frozen "scuttling" when it can't connect to the SSB server (because it's being used by another process).

Once it's finished scuttling you can copy and paste your feed ID (`@pMMUGwiEuuU1WKTQlby9SM/wkY4s0VKLqZ+P+Wmewpc=.ed25519`) into the search box and manually follow it from your wife's computer, and when they're on the same wifi they should definitely peer.

Hope that helps!
